channel.title: Can you read this
channel.description:
i would like to know how many moparscapians could read this, i found it quite interesting, and with a study only about 55% of people COULD actually read it!
I cdnuolt blveiee taht I cluod aulaclty uesdnatnrd waht I was rdanieg. The phaonmneal pweor of the hmuan mnid, aoccdrnig to a rscheearch at Cmabrigde Uinervtisy, it dseno't mtaetr in waht oerdr the ltteres in a wrod are, the olny iproamtnt tihng is taht the frsit and lsat ltteer be in the rghit pclae. The rset can be a taotl mses and you can sitll raed it whotuit a pboerlm. Tihs is bcuseae the huamn mnid deos not raed ervey lteter by istlef, but the wrod as a wlohe. Azanmig huh? yaeh and I awlyas tghuhot slpeling was ipmorantt!

item.title: Can you read this
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

ranger squad:

Tu madre es muy bien en mi cama. Mi gusta mucho tu madre en mi cama. Tu madre es muy intersante, pero muy feo y gordo.

Tu madre es una puta.

[quote=“Taharok, post:25, topic:279264”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=368579.msg2792527#msg2792527 date=1242866584]

Yo tengo muy bueno Ingles.

That’s wrong.

‘Hablo ingles muy bueno.’
[/quote]

Taht’s wnrog too.

‘Hablo en ingles muy bueno’[/quote]
I asked my Spanish teacher today. He says that phrase is an exception and should be ‘Hablo ingles muy bueno’.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you read this
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:26, topic:279264”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=368579.msg2792774#msg2792774 date=1242880464]

Yo tengo muy bueno Ingles.

That’s wrong.

‘Hablo ingles muy bueno.’

Taht’s wnrog too.

‘Hablo en ingles muy bueno’
[/quote]

Talk in English really good? I don’t think that’s right…

I think it’s: Yo hablo ingles muy bien.[/quote]

When speaking in Spanish, you use the normal translated expressions, not a transliteration. We say in English “I speak english”. In Spanish, they literally say “I speak in spanish”, and that’s how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you read this
item.dc:creator: @Girona Girona
item.description:
@Girona wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:19, topic:279264”][quote author=Girona link=topic=368579.msg2791600#msg2791600 date=1242806141]

This is quite easy to decipher, it is quite easy to distinguish all of the letters into one word if you are from an English speaking country.

It has also been proven, I think, that only people who speak and read English can do this.
[/quote]I speak Dutch and I came to Australia when I was 9, I find my English fine and I can read this.

I’m talking about other people from different countries cannot do it to their own language, like for example a dutch person may not be able to do it to his language.

This is what I’ve heard anyway, not what I know.[/quote]Yeah, if you got a Dutch sentence and told me to do it I would fail terribly, over the last 7 years of me learning English I’m not that good in Dutch either, but, the way I am thinking is same as you are. :o

Read full topic

item.title: Can you read this
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Girona, post:15, topic:279264”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=368579.msg2790915#msg2790915 date=1242760758]
This is quite easy to decipher, it is quite easy to distinguish all of the letters into one word if you are from an English speaking country.

It has also been proven, I think, that only people who speak and read English can do this.
[/quote]I speak Dutch and I came to Australia when I was 9, I find my English fine and I can read this.[/quote]

I’m talking about other people from different countries cannot do it to their own language, like for example a dutch person may not be able to do it to his language.

This is what I’ve heard anyway, not what I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you read this
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Scarecrows, post:14, topic:279264”][quote author=Newty link=topic=368579.msg2791481#msg2791481 date=1242793445]

Yaeh, I kenw aoubt tihs. Rehatr tahn bineg eaclxty fcistananig, it’s no rael srpirsue taht msot poelpe can atlcaluy raed the frsit psot. Hweover, can you raed tihs psot, as I am tynirg so hrad to mkae you fial and flal falt on yuor ass. Oh wlel, the rael srerect is to use as ltlite one, two, and trehe lteetr wrdos as psoislbe. Tehn you can sumtp yuor adnceuie all you lkie.

Hppay wrod shcitnwig!

Yeah, I knew about this. Rather than being exactly fasinating, it’s no real surprise that most people can actually read the first post. However, can you read this pors, as I am trying so hard to make you fail and fall flat on your ass. Oh well, the real seceret is to use as little one, two, and three letter words as possible. Then you can stump your audience all you like.

Happy word …?

What in the hell is the last word? SO close, almost had Taharok beat…
[/quote]

Switching.

Found this pretty interesting btw :)[/quote]

Ahhh of course, thank you.

Read full topic
